{{pp-semi-indef}} {{primary sources|date=August 2013}} Beginning with ''[[Red's Dream]]'' and its references to previous [[Pixar Animation Studios|Pixar]] short films, Pixar has included references in its films to other works produced by the studio.<ref name="pixarpedia" /> These have included [[cameo appearance]]s, references to characters, objects, and titles of works. Additionally, such [[easter eggs]] or in-jokes can refer to Pixar staff, associates, or places or events from the company's past. Lastly, some items, such as [[A113]], '''Pizza Planet''' or actor [[John Ratzenberger]] have appeared in the majority of Pixar films, establishing a set of traditions that subsequent Pixar films try to include.
The following is a '''list of all documented self-referential nods contained within Pixar films''' and shorts that the various filmmakers have incorporated into their movies. {{TOC right}}
==Traditions==
===A113=== {{Main article|A113}} A113 is an [[Easter egg (media)|Easter egg]] that has been inserted into several animated television shows and feature films<ref name=pixarpedia> {{cite book |title=Pixarpedia |publisher=DK Adult |author=DK Publishing |year=2009 |isbn=978-0-7566-5432-0 |page=297 }}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=Disney•Pixar|title=Pixar Did You Know: A113 {{!}} Disney•Pixar|date=2017-09-29|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NyrrZqPI42I|accessdate=2018-03-04}}</ref> as a homage to a classroom at [[California Institute of the Arts|CalArts]], the [[alma mater]] of Pixar/Disney executive [[John Lasseter]] and [[film director|director]] [[Brad Bird]], among others. Bird was the first to use the A113 Easter egg,<ref>{{cite video| people = Jeff Goldsmith, Andrew Stanton| title = Andrew Stanton: Wall-E Q&A podcast|publisher = Creative Screenwriting Magazine|date= 2008-12-16|accessdate=2009-01-03|format=MP3|time=05:15| url = http://creativescreenwritingmagazine.blogspot.com/2008/12/andrew-stanton-wall-e-q.html}}</ref> on a car license plate in an animated segment entitled ''Family Dog'' in a 1987 episode of the television series ''[[Amazing Stories (TV series)|Amazing Stories]]''. * ''[[Toy Story]]'' trilogy - License plate number on Andy's mom's [[minivan]], later replaced by a [[Crossover (automobile)|CUV]] in ''[[Toy Story 3]]''.<ref>{{cite video| people = Jeff Goldsmith, Andrew Stanton| title = Andrew Stanton: Wall-E Q&A podcast| publisher = Creative Screenwriting Magazine|date= 2008-12-16| accessdate=2009-01-03|format=MP3|time=05:30|url = http://creativescreenwritingmagazine.blogspot.com/2008/12/andrew-stanton-wall-e-q.html}}</ref><ref name="themovieblogts3">{{cite web | url=http://www.themovieblog.com/2010/02/easter-eggs-found-in-toy-story-3-trailer | title=Easter Eggs Found in Toy Story 3 Trailer | author=Rodney | date=2010-02-12 | accessdate=2010-02-27 | publisher=TheMovieBlog.net}}</ref> * ''[[A Bug's Life]]'' - Code on cereal box as Flik enters the bug city.<ref name="pixartalkee">{{cite web|url=http://www.pixartalk.com/easter-eggs/toy-story-monsters-inc/ |title=Toy Story - Monsters, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-27 |author=Greg Mariotti |publisher=PixarTalk |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100109112925/http://www.pixartalk.com/easter-eggs/toy-story-monsters-inc/ |archivedate=January 9, 2010 }}</ref> * ''[[Toy Story 2]]'' - Airport announcement for "LassetAir Flight A113" (also a reference to director [[John Lasseter]]). * ''[[Finding Nemo]]'' - Model code on camera used by scuba diver.<ref>{{cite video|date= 2003-05-30|title= Finding Nemo |medium= Motion Picture|publisher=Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2008-10-13|time=14:52}}</ref> * ''[[The Incredibles]]'' - Room number in Syndrome's lair (not seen, only mentioned by Mirage).<ref>{{cite video |date= 2004-11-05|title=The Incredibles|medium= Motion Picture|publisher=Pixar|location=Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-06-02 |time = 46:42}}</ref> Also, the prison level where Mr. Incredible is held is "Level A1" in Cell #13: A1 & 13<ref>{{cite video|date=2004-11-05|title= The Incredibles|medium= Motion Picture|publisher=Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-06-02|time=1:18:05}}</ref> and as, Elastigirl looks to the computer, in the "Level A1" diagram, the higher column is labeled "13". * ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'' - The number of the freight train that almost crashes into Lightning McQueen while he is first on his way to Radiator Springs.<ref name="comingsoonpixarrat" /><ref>{{cite video|date=2006-06-09|title= Cars|medium = Motion Picture|publisher = Pixar|location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2008-10-15|time= 23:01}}</ref> It is also [[List of Cars characters#Mater|Mater]]'s license plate in both the film and the related short film, ''[[Mater and the Ghost Light]]''.<ref>{{cite video|date=2006-11-07|title= Mater and the Ghost Light|medium= Short|publisher=Pixar|location=Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-15|time=4:58}}</ref> * ''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'' - Git, the lab rat, has a tag on his left ear that reads "A113".<ref>{{cite video |date = 2007-06-29|title=Ratatouille|medium=Motion Picture|publisher=Pixar|location=Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2009-01-23 |time= 1:11:##}}</ref> Also, when Linguini falls asleep to the old movie, A113 is seen on the screen.<ref>[http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/pixar/images/1/10/RatatouilleA113.png/revision/latest?cb=20120826171114 Picture of A113]</ref> * ''[[WALL-E]]'' - A113 is the code for the [[directive (programming)|directive]] given to the ''Axiom''{{'}}s autopilot to never return to Earth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/2008/06/27/interview-andrew-stanton/|title=Interview: Andrew Stanton|date=2008-06-27|accessdate=2008-12-28|publisher=SlashFilm|author=Peter Sciretta}}</ref><ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27|title= WALL-E|medium=Motion Picture|publisher = Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2008-12-07|time= 1:08:48}}</ref> This to date has been the largest involvement of the "A113" easter egg in the plot of a Pixar film. * ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]]'' - A113 is the number of the court room.<ref name="slashup"/> * ''[[Cars 2]]'' - A113 is the number on Siddeley's tail.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.slashfilm.com/cars-2-characters-rod-torque-redline-siddeley/ | title=Meet Two New ‘Cars 2′ Characters: Rod "Torque" Redline and Siddeley | date=2011-02-24 | author=Han, Angie | accessdate=2011-03-05 | publisher=''[[/Film]]''}}</ref> It remains the number on Mater's license plate, and it is part of the image number on the spy photo of Miles Axelrod's engine. * ''[[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]]'' - A113 is written in [[Roman numerals]] (ACXIII) above the entrance to the witch's shack. * ''[[Monsters University]]'' - A113 is the classroom of Scare 101. * ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]'' - When Riley is walking up a street in San Francisco going towards the bus, she stops to see who is calling her. In the background, "A113" is written in graffiti on a building. When Riley Anderson heads to her new school in [[San Francisco]], she is put in room A113.<ref>"[http://blog.bcdb.com/a113/15-inside-out/ Inside Out - Pixar Trivia, Easter Eggs and A-113]". ''blog.bcdb.com'', June 26, 2015</ref> * ''[[The Good Dinosaur]]'' - A113 can be seen in a formation of sticks. * ''[[Finding Dory]]'' - The tags that are seen on Fluke and Rudder read "A1" and "13". The license plate on the truck then reads "CALA113", referencing to California Institute of Arts A113. * ''[[Cars 3]]'' - Sterling's office in the Rust-Eze Racing Center is numbered A113. * ''[[Coco (2017 film)|Coco]]'' - The office in the Bureau of Family Greivances is numbered A113. * ''[[Incredibles 2]]'' - At the end of the film, the Parrs about to drop Violet and Tony off at a movie. On the marquee, the film is called ''Dementia 113'', but one side makes it appear to read Dementi A113.
===John Ratzenberger=== Described as "Pixar's good luck charm" by John Lasseter, actor [[John Ratzenberger]] has played a role in every Pixar feature to date,<ref name="comingsoonpixarrat" /><ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2008-11-25|url=http://www.nbc.com/Last_Comic_Standing/about/scouts-john-ratzenberger.shtml|title=John Ratzenberger Information and Professional Biography |publisher=[[NBC]] }}</ref> including a few not produced by Pixar{{efn|Both ''Planes'' and its sequel were produced by DisneyToon Studios instead of Pixar, but were set in the world of ''Cars''}}.
* ''[[Toy Story]], [[Toy Story 2]], and [[Toy Story 3]]'' - Hamm * ''[[A Bug's Life]]'' - P.T. Flea * ''[[Monsters, Inc.]]'' and ''[[Monsters University]]'' - Abominable Snowman * ''[[Finding Nemo]]'' - School of fish * ''[[The Incredibles]]'' and ''[[The Incredibles 2]]'' - The Underminer * ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'', ''[[Cars 2]]'', ''[[Cars 3]]'' - Mack ** At the end of ''Cars'', there is a [[drive-in theater]] that shows John Ratzenberger as some of the parts of the movies, which are car-versions of ''Toy (Car) Story'', ''A [[Volkswagen Bug|Bug]]'s Life'', and ''Monster (Trucks) Inc.'' Mack even notes that they keep using the same actor again. * ''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'' - Mustafa the waiter * ''[[WALL-E]]'' - John * ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]]'' - Tom the foreman * ''[[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]]'' - Gordon the guard * ''[[Planes (film)|Planes]]'' - Harland * ''[[Planes: Fire & Rescue]]'' - Brodi * ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]'' - Fritz * ''[[The Good Dinosaur]]'' - Earl the velociraptor * ''[[Finding Dory]]'' - Bill the crab * ''[[Coco (2017 film)|Coco]]'' - Juan Ortodoncia, a skeleton in the Land of the Dead with bad teeth
===Luxo Ball=== A yellow ball with a blue stripe and a red star, which was first shown in the short ''[[Luxo, Jr.]]'', has been shown in the Pixar logo sequence and several Pixar feature films and shorts, most prominently in the [[Toy Story (franchise)|''Toy Story'' franchise]].<ref>{{Citation|last=Disney•Pixar|title=Luxo Ball Easter Eggs {{!}} Disney•Pixar|date=2017-09-22|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VcC2SBqBhc0|accessdate=2018-03-04}}</ref> * In ''[[Red's Dream]]'', the circut's carpet is styled like the Luxo Ball. * In ''Toy Story'', a Luxo Ball rolls down the hallway of Andy's house as Sarge helps an "injured" soldier to an indoor plant.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} * One of Andy's friends bounces the Luxo Ball up the stairs to Andy's room.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} * When Buzz Lightyear demonstrates how he "flies" in ''Toy Story'', he bounces off a Luxo Ball.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> * In the accompanying "Animated Storybook" CD-ROM, a Luxo Ball appears on the page where Woody and Sid's toys thought of an escape plan (consisting of three separate minigames). It acts as an obstacle in Babyface's minigame (where Babyface had to steer the toys down the stairs, trying not to step on any obstacles). * In ''Toy Story 2'', one Luxo Ball appears in a TV commercial for Al's Toy Barn.<ref name="pixartalkee" /><ref>{{cite video|date=|title=Toy Story 2 |medium=Motion Picture|publisher=Pixar|location=Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-01-02|time=00:06:51}}</ref> * Several Luxo Balls can be seen when the toys enter Al's Toy Barn in ''Toy Story 2'': when entering the store, one can be easily seen to the left;<ref>{{cite video |date=|title= Toy Story 2 |medium= Motion Picture|publisher = Pixar|location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-01-02|time= 00:40:30}}</ref> when leaving, a whole container of Luxo Balls can be seen to the left.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} * A Luxo Ball is present in the ''Toy Story 3'' teaser: Bullseye is rolling around on it and appearing as the "o" in the Toy Story logo.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} * A Luxo Ball appears in a trailer for ''Toy Story'' and ''Toy Story 2'' double feature in [[Disney Digital 3-D]]. * In the waiting room, there is a chest of toys, and you can see the yellow part of the ball and a little bit of the red star. * In Boo's room in ''[[Monsters, Inc.]]'' When Boo returns to her room, she gives Sulley the ball.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref name="monstersinc1">{{cite video|date=2009-11-14|title= Presto|medium= Video|publisher=Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2009-11-14|time= 1:32}}</ref> * In the ''Incredibles'' short film ''[[Jack-Jack Attack]]''.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> * Falling out of Presto's sleeve in ''[[Presto (film)|Presto]]''.<ref>{{cite video|date=2008-06-27|title=Presto|medium= Video|publisher = Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate=2008-10-28|time=2:36}}</ref> * On the floor of a neighbor child's room<ref>{{cite video|date=2008-11-07|title=Up (trailer)|medium=Trailer|publisher=Pixar|location=Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2008-11-07|time= 1:06}}<!-- Note: this citation is for the trailer of unreleased film; citation will need to be updated when the film is released IF the scene remains in the final film --></ref> and on one of Russel's merit badges in ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]].<ref name="slashup"/> * The ball's design pattern appeared on the floor of the circus ring in ''[[Red's Dream]]''.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> * In ''[[Toy Story 3]]'', the Luxo Ball can be seen in a shelf above where Woody first meets the [[Chatter Telephone]].<ref>{{cite video |date = 2010-06-18 |title = Toy Story 3 |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2013-07-12 |time = 55:00 }}</ref> At the end the Luxo Ball can be seen getting played around with at Sunnyside Daycare in the Sandbox.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2010-06-18 |title = Toy Story 3 |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2013-07-12 |time = 1:34:58 }}</ref> The pattern on the Luxo ball can also be seen on the wall outside Sunnyside Daycare.<ref name="csts3" /> * In ''[[Monsters University]]'', the ball is seen drawn on the wall for a demonstration of how anything a child touches is toxic. * In ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]'', the ball is seen in a flashback of Riley playing tag with Bing Bong.
===Pizza Planet=== Pizza Planet is a fictional [[pizza]] restaurant that appears in ''[[Toy Story]]''.<ref name="toy story">{{cite video|date=1995|title=[[Toy Story]]|medium=[[DVD]]|publisher=[[Walt Disney Pictures]]}}</ref> In the film, it is a large, [[science fiction|sci-fi]]-themed restaurant with arcade games including robot guards at the entrance. The company runs a fleet of derelict [[Toyota Hilux]] pickup trucks (as evidenced by the inscription on the tailgate; it is a Toyota inscription with the first and last two letters, "TO" and "TA", worn off so it simply appears as "YO") with a rocket on the roof featuring the restaurant's logo, as seen in ''Toy Story'', ''[[Toy Story 2]]'' and ''[[Toy Story 3]]'' (though in ''Toy Story 2'', the truck model is called a "Gyoza" as seen on the owner's manual). There is a Pizza Planet reference in every Pixar feature film<ref>{{Citation|last=Disney|title=Pixar Pizza Planet Truck Easter Eggs {{!}} Disney|date=2015-03-30|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UcCEdu2RF1E|accessdate=2018-03-04}}</ref> to date except for the film ''[[The Incredibles]]''. [[Lee Unkrich]] has said that there is no Pizza Planet truck anywhere in ''[[The Incredibles]]''.<ref name="jimhillmedia"> {{cite web | url=http://jimhillmedia.com/blogs/jim_hill/archive/2007/12/09/a-special-where-s-wall-e-edition-of-why-for.aspx| title=A special "Where's WALL-E" edition of Why For? | author=Jim Hill | work=jimhillmedia.com | date=2007-12-09 | accessdate=2008-07-21 }}</ref><ref name="leeunkrichanswered"> {{cite web | url=http://www.formspring.me/leeunkrich/q/556391712 | title=leeunkrich answered | author=Lee Unkrich | date=2010-05-10 | accessdate=2010-06-24 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100625043310/http://www.formspring.me/leeunkrich/q/556391712 | archivedate=2010-06-25 | df= }}</ref> *In ''Toy Story'', Woody sees the truck at the gas station and tells Buzz it is a spaceship with hyper-active hyperdrive which they head on it to the restaurant itself. *In ''[[A Bug's Life]]'', the truck appears in the scene where one insect warns another not to touch a motor home's [[bug zapper]].<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> A Pizza Planet cup also appears in the Bug City.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> *In '' Toy Story 2'', Hamm, Buzz, [[Mr. Potato Head]], Slinky and Rex use the truck to chase after Al to the airport. *In ''[[Monsters, Inc.]]'', when a [[redneck]] mother is beating Randall with a shovel, the truck is on the far left side of the screen. This is the same motor home that appeared in ''A Bug's Life''.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video|title=[[A Bug's Life]]|publisher=[[Disney]]|date=1998}}</ref><ref>{{cite video|title=[[Monsters, Inc.]]|publisher=[[Disney]]|date=2001}}</ref> *In ''[[Finding Nemo]]'', while Gill is explaining his plan to escape from the dentist office, a yellow Pizza Planet truck drives by.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2003-05-30 |title = Finding Nemo |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-13 |time = 39:34 }}</ref> *In ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'', there is an anthropomorphic Pizza Planet truck named Todd at the stadium for the final race. There also exists a diecast car of it.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2006-06-09 |title = Cars |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-15 |time = 1:33:01 }}</ref> *In ''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'', the Pizza Planet truck is briefly seen crossing the bridge over the [[Seine]] when Skinner is chasing Remy.<ref name="comingsoonpixarrat" /><ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2007-06-29 |title = Ratatouille |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-14 |time = 1:14:13 }}</ref> *In ''[[WALL-E]]'', EVE scans the engine of a Pizza Planet truck for plant life shortly after her arrival on Earth, and shuts the hood afterwards.<ref name="walleslashilm">{{cite web | url=http://www.slashfilm.com/2008/06/27/wall-e-easter-eggs/ | title=WALL-E Easter Eggs | author=Peter Sciretta | work=Slashfilm.com | date=2008-06-27 | accessdate=2008-07-02 }}</ref><ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 21:11 }}</ref> *In ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]]'', the Pizza Planet truck is seen on the street as Carl's house floats by, although the truck has more of a delivery van appearance than the actual truck in other films. An actual Pizza Planet truck can be seen in a parking lot when Carl has a fantasy of leaving Russell. At the end, when Carl takes Russell and Dug for ice cream, the real Pizza Planet truck can be seen parked.<ref name="slashup">{{cite web |url=http://www.slashfilm.com/2009/05/31/easter-eggs-in-pixars-up/ |work=SlashFilm.com |author=Peter Sciretta |title=Easter Eggs in Pixar's UP |date=2009-06-01 |accessdate=2009-06-01 |time= }}</ref> *In ''Toy Story 3'', the Pizza Planet truck is the vehicle that Lots-o-Huggin' Bear, Big Baby, and Chuckles rides on to get around Sunnyside Daycare. Pizza Planet is also seen as a calendar sponsor.<ref name="slashts3film" /> *In ''[[Cars 2]]'', Todd the Pizza Planet truck is attending to the Radiator Springs Grand Prix. He also appears in the background of a triptych poster of the movie, in front of Buckingham Palace. *In ''[[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]]'' the Pizza Planet Truck appears as a wood carving in the witches cottage.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/11-learned-pixars-brave-d23-expo/ |title=11 Things We’ve Learned About Pixar’s ‘Brave’ [D23 Expo] | /Film |publisher=Slashfilm.com |date=2011-08-22 |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref> [[John Lasseter]] commented in an interview that although the story of ''Brave'' takes place in the past, they found a way to put the Pizza Planet Truck in the story.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6nBMm_c2yP8 |title=Pizza Planet Truck in Pixar's BRAVE? |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-08-29 |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://pixartimes.com/2011/05/28/discuss-will-the-pizza-planet-truck-be-able-to-cameo-in-brave/ |title=Discuss: Will The Pizza Planet Truck Be Able To Cameo in Brave? |publisher=Pixartimes.com |date=2011-05-28 |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref> *In ''[[Monsters University]]'', the Pizza Planet truck is parked outside the first house party. *In ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]'', the Pizza Planet truck can be seen in one of Riley's memory orbs. *In ''[[The Good Dinosaur]]'', an asteroid in the shape of the Pizza Planet truck can be seen in the asteroid belt. *In ''[[Finding Dory]]'', the Pizza Planet truck can be seen underwater in the wreckage. *In ''[[Cars 3]]'', Todd the Pizza Planet truck is attending at the ThunderHollow speedway. *In ''[[Coco (2017 film)|Coco]]'', the truck appears in a brief montage playing loud music to show Abuela's ban on music. *In ''[[Incredibles 2]]'', the truck appears after Elastigirl saves the Screenslaver. In this film, the truck has been redesigned to match the other cars in the series.
Pizza Planet restaurants at [[Walt Disney World]]'s [[Disney's Hollywood Studios]] and [[Disneyland Paris]] are named after the site in the film and are designed to resemble it.
==Companies== To avoid overt [[product placement]] in Pixar films, a series of [[fictional company|fictional companies]] are used as placeholders. Some appear only in one franchise (such as fictional [[NASCAR]] sponsors in [[Cars (film)|Cars]]) but others serve as recurring themes.
===Buy n Large (BnL)=== '''Buy n Large''' is a fictional [[mega-corporation]] that first appeared in ''[[WALL-E]]'' as the entity which controlled all economic and government services on the future Earth. *'''''WALL-E''''' **Buy n Large logos are seen throughout the movie and the company president appears in a message to the captain of the ''Axiom''. *'''''Up''''' **BnL logos are seen on the construction equipment surrounding Carl's house.<ref name="slashup" /> *'''''Tokyo Mater''''' **A jumbotron in Tokyo advertises a "lugnut in a cup". *'''''Toy Story 3''''' ** Buzz Lightyear's batteries are "BnL Alkaline".<ref name="jppts3tt" /> *'''''Cars 3''''' **Jackson Storm was racing in the BnL Raceway
===Dinoco=== '''Dinoco''' is a fictional [[petroleum|oil]] [[company]] that first appeared in ''[[Toy Story]]'' as a small gas station. It plays a central role as a key race car sponsor in ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'', and made a small cameo in ''[[WALL-E]]''.<ref name="toy story" /> The company's logo is a dinosaur, but with an ''[[Apatosaurus]]'' in ''Toy Story'' and a ''[[Tyrannosaurus]]'' in ''Cars'' (a reference to [[Sinclair Oil Corporation|Sinclair Oil]], which uses a similar dinosaur logo). *'''''Toy Story''''' ** Andy's Mom goes to the gas station to fuel and it's where Woody and Buzz fight and were left behind.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jimhillmedia.com/mb/images/upload/Dinoco-Filling-Station-web.jpg|title=Screen capture from Toy Story}}</ref> *'''''Cars''''' ** The company's branding uses a pale blue shade referred to as "Dinoco blue", originally created for [[Richard Petty]]'s racecar. "The King" is portrayed with Dinoco branding as #43, a [[Plymouth Superbird]]. Dinoco is the most lucrative [[sponsor (commercial)|sponsor]] in the [[Piston Cup]], a parody of NASCAR's Grand National driver's trophy series,<ref name="filmjunkpixaree">{{cite web | url=http://www.filmjunk.com/2008/01/25/pixar-easter-eggs-and-self-referential-inside-jokes/ | title=Pixar Easter Eggs and Self-Referential Inside Jokes | author=Sean | date=2008-01-25 | accessdate=2010-02-27 | publisher=FilmJunk.com}}</ref> lending its name to the "Dinoco 400" race at the [[Bristol Motor Speedway|"Motor Speedway of the South"]], an enlarged Bristol Speedway. Its owner [[Tex Dinoco|Tex]] is a loyal, longtime sponsor of [[Strip "The King" Weathers|The King]] #43, a veteran racer on the verge of retirement.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> This corporate sponsorship is the primary trophy for which the race cars in ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'' contend. The Dinoco brand features prominently in much ''Cars''-related merchandise.<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2008-04-22 |url=http://pixaranimation.blogspot.com/2006/04/dinoco.html |title=Dinoco |publisher=Luxo |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071219181400/http://pixaranimation.blogspot.com/2006/04/dinoco.html |archivedate=December 19, 2007 }}</ref> * '''''WALL-E''''' ** The Dinoco name and logo appear on a lighter.<ref>{{cite video
|date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-12-23 |time = 7:27 }}</ref> *'''''Cars 2''''' ** On the plane to Tokyo, a Stewardess is seen holding cans with the Dinoco logo on them and Mater, in Japan, drinks Dinoco fuel at the [[sumo]] fight. *'''''Cars 3''''' ** After trainer Cruz Ramirez wins the final race of the film (the first of the new Piston Cup season), Tex offers her a chance to race for Dinoco and she accepts.
==Movies==
===''Toy Story'' trilogy=== These Pixar films contain the following references to ''[[Toy Story]]'', ''[[Toy Story 2]]'', or ''[[Toy Story 3]]'': *'''''A Bug's Life''''' **In one of the bloopers that play during the end credits, Flik, as he is about to take flight, quotes Buzz Lightyear's catchphrase "To Infinity and Beyond". **One of the additional bloopers features Woody as a crewman, running the [[clapperboard]],<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> appearing after Dr. Flora accidentally pronounced Atta as "Princess [[ABBA|Abba]]", and she, with Mr. Soil, jokes of it after. *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **Andy's cloud wallpaper is shown while Randall is practicing his scares.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> **When Boo returns home at the end, a Jessie doll is seen on her table.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> She then hands Sulley the doll.<ref name="monstersinc1"/> **During a blooper, while Mike and Sulley are walking to work, they wait at a crosswalk next to Ted's leg, who roars and stomps his feet. The camera zooms out to reveal that the leg belongs to Rex, who then asks anxiously how it went, if he can do it again and promises to be taller. In the actual film, Ted makes chicken sounds. {{Citation needed|date=September 2008}} **A larger version of a clown toy from Andy's Room appears at the laugh floor at the end near the scream canisters.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> **Fungus gives Randall a copy of the ''Monstropolis Horn'', which features an article by Al Whiggin. Al's full name from ''Toy Story 2'' is Al McWhiggin. **The toy airplane that Buzz lands on when first attempting to fly is seen on a shelf at the beginning of the film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://what-does-he-know.blogspot.com/search?updated-max=2010-08-24T23%3A26%3A00%2B01%3A00&max-results=7 |title=What-does-he-know? |publisher=What-does-he-know.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2013}} *'''''Finding Nemo''''' **When Nemo is frantically looking for a way to escape the fish tank in the dentist's office, a Buzz Lightyear action figure can be seen lying next to the toy box in the waiting room.<ref name="Finding Nemo">{{cite video |date = 2003-05-30 |title = Finding Nemo |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-13 |time = 25:39 }}</ref> *'''''The Incredibles''''' **The [[Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots]] from ''Toy Story 2'' appear in Bob Parr's office. *'''''Cars''''' ** The tires of all the Piston Cup racers (including Lightning McQueen) are Lightyear Buzzard tires, a reference to Buzz Lightyear and [[Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company|Goodyear]] [[Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company#Automotive|Eagle]] tires.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/motoring/wheelsonfilm/2754271/Wheels-On-Film-Cars.html |title=Wheels On Film: Cars |publisher=Telegraph UK |date= |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref> ** The drive-in movie shows ''Toy Car Story'', featuring stylized car versions of ''Toy Story'' characters Woody, Buzz, and Hamm. ** Lightning McQueen's race number is '''#95''', the year the first ''Toy Story'' was released. *'''''WALL-E''''' **Rex is seen in Wall-E's house.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 6:11 }}</ref> ** Barbie's car and a Buzz Lightyear lunchbox are seen.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} ** Hamm can be seen in Wall-E's house when EVE visits.<ref name="walleslashilm" /> ** The orange traffic cones from ''Toy Story 2'' can be seen in garbage piles and Wall-E's room.<ref name="walleslashilm" /> *'''''Up''''' **The grape soda brand for the bottle cap that Ellie gives to Carl is the same as seen in the Buzz Lightyear commercial in ''Toy Story''.<ref name="slashup"/> **Lots-O'-Huggin' Bear can be seen as the balloons pass a child's room.<ref name="slashup"/>
===''A Bug's Life''=== These Pixar films and shorts contain the following references to ''[[A Bug's Life]]'': *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **The opening video game sequence takes place in a space-themed, differently-colored version of Ant Island. **The calendar in Andy's room shows a still image of ants carrying food and walking across a blade of grass.<ref name="pixartalkee" /><ref>{{cite video |date = |title = Toy Story 2 |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-01-02 |time = 00:04:32}}</ref> **When Mrs. Potato Head is waiting for her earring, she's reading a storybook of ''A Bug's Life''.<ref name="pixartalkee"/><ref>{{cite video |date=|title= Toy Story 2|medium= Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location= Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-01-02 |time= 00:05:52}}</ref> **Heimlich can be seen as a small caterpillar, crawling on a branch just before Buzz cuts through.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video|date=|title= Toy Story 2 |medium= Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-01-02|time= 00:36:28}}</ref> **Characters are seen as toys after the "NEW" banner at Al's Toy Barn is seen.<ref name="pixartalkee" /><ref>{{cite video |date = |title = Toy Story 2 |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-01-02 |time = 00:42:12}}</ref> **The tree on top of the hill during the "When She Loved Me" sequence is the same tree that tops Ant Island.<ref name="pixartalkee"/> **The main theme from ''A Bug's Life'' can be heard in an elevator music rendition in the elevator where Al is going down to head to Japan. **Flik and Heimlich are the only two cast members to reprise their roles from ''A Bug's Life'', appearing in an outtake of the movie, expressing their excitement of their first day of filming as they climb the branches. Flik is pleased with Heimlich, thinking that he talked to the producers about doing a sequel, but the latter later clarified that the sequel is not ''A Bug's Life 2'', leaving Flik confused. When he asks Heimlich what the sequel is, the camera starts rolling and the giant Buzz makes his entrance by clearing the bush they are on, sending them flying. *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **The place Randall gets banished to is the old trailer with the deadly bug light.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> *'''''Cars''''' **The drive-in movie shows ''A Bug's Life'', featuring stylized car versions of characters Flik, the circus bugs and P.T. Flea.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2006-06-09 |title = Cars |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2008-10-15|time= 1:51:51}}</ref> *'''''Your Friend, The Rat''''' **P.T. Flea appears when the rats are talking about fleas causing the [[Black Death]].<ref>{{cite video |date = 2007-11-06 |title = Your Friend, The Rat |medium = Video |publisher = Pixar|location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-14|time= 2:30}}</ref> *'''''WALL-E''''' **The bug-zapper is seen.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **An ant toy is seen during the breakout.{{Citation needed|date=June 2010}} **When Woody climbs into the ceiling at Sunnyside, letters spelling ATTA, the name of the Princess are seen.<ref name="csts3" /> **A toy version of Flik can be seen jumping away as the line of children are about to come back in from recess.<ref name="csts3" />
===''Monsters, Inc.''=== These Pixar films contain the following references to ''[[Monsters, Inc.]]'' or ''[[Monsters University]]'': *'''''Finding Nemo''''' **The fish [[mobile (sculpture)|mobile]] found in the dentist's office is the same one featured in Boo's room.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} **Mike can be seen swimming in scuba gear during the credits.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2003-05-30 |title = Finding Nemo |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-13 |time = 1:39:13 }}</ref> **Boo's teddy bear can be spotted in the toy chest at the dentist's office.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://what-does-he-know.blogspot.com/search?q=PIXAR |title="What does he know" search for PIXAR |publisher= |date= |accessdate=2013-10-30}}</ref>{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2013}} *'''''Cars''''' **The drive-in movie shows ''Monster Trucks, Inc'', featuring stylized car versions of characters Sulley, Mike, and the Abominable Snowman (here known as the Abominable Snowplow).<ref>{{cite video |date = 2006-06-09 |title = Cars |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-15 |time = 1:51:30 }}</ref> *'''''Tokyo Mater''''' ** While Mater is trying to drift Mike and Sulley, in their stylized car forms, can be briefly seen when he has drifted out of the restaurant. * '''''WALL-E''''' ** One of the many garbage cubes in the movie is the garbage cube Sulley had thought Boo was in. Also, a Mike Wazowski antenna ball is seen.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-12-23 |time = 9:25 }}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 3''''' ** A girl in the Butterfly Room at Sunnyside looks like a slightly older Boo.<ref name="slashts3film" /> ** Toy versions of Boo and Mike Wazowski are seen in Sunnyside Daycare.<ref name="csts3" /> *'''''Brave''''' **A wood carving of Sulley can be seen in the Witch's shack.
===''Finding Nemo''=== These Pixar films and shorts contain the following references to ''[[Finding Nemo]]'': *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **Before Mike says "And he is....outta here!" as they're throwing Randall through the door, Nemo can be seen hanging on the wall.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2001-11-02 |title = Monsters, Inc. |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-05-27 |time = 1:12:34 }}</ref> **Boo gives Sulley a Nemo toy before he leaves her room. (As ''Monsters, Inc.'' was made before ''Finding Nemo'' this was a sneak peek)<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref name="monstersinc1"/> **On the wall behind the sushi chef at Harryhausen's, there is a clownfish.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> *'''''WALL-E''''' **In the end credits, Crush appears as a [[mosaic]].<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 1:31:15 }}</ref> *'''''Boundin'''''' **The arm that grabs the lamb belongs to the dentist.<ref name="boundincomm">''Boundin''' commentary by Bud Luckey.</ref><ref>{{cite video |date = 2004-11-05 |title = Boundin' |medium = Motion Picture Short |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-03-07 |time = 0:01:10 }}</ref> **The fish are based on Gurgle.<ref name="boundincomm" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2004-11-05 |title = Boundin' |medium = Motion Picture Short |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-03-07 |time = 0:01:05 }}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **Mr. Ray is on a shelf at the daycare.<ref name="slashts3tt">{{cite web | url=http://www.slashfilm.com/2010/02/12/toy-story-3-trailer-easter-eggs-revealed/ | title= Toy Story 3 Trailer Easter Eggs Revealed | publisher=slashfilm.net | author=Peter Sciretta | date=2010-02-12 | accessdate=2010-03-21}}</ref> **One of the dolphins is on a shelf at the daycare.<ref name="colliderts3tt">{{cite web | url=http://www.collider.com/2010/02/12/toy-story-3-trailer-easter-eggs-everything-from-totoro-to-tin-toy/ | title= TOY STORY 3 Trailer Easter Eggs - Everything from Totoro to Tin Toy | publisher=Collider | author=Steve Weintraub | date=2010-02-12 | accessdate=2010-03-21}}</ref> **A Nemo sticker is seen on Andy's toy dresser.<ref name="csts3" /> **Images of Nemo and Dory are seen on the wall at Sunnyside Daycare when Buzz escapes the Caterpillar room.<ref name="slashts3film" />
===''The Incredibles''=== These Pixar films contain the following references to ''[[The Incredibles]]'': *'''''Finding Nemo''''' **A young boy in the dentist's office is reading a [[Mr. Incredible]] comic book.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2003-05-30 |title = Finding Nemo |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-13 |time = 1:19:32 }}</ref> *'''''Ratatouille''''' ** Bomb Voyage appears as a mime.<ref name="comingsoonpixarrat">{{cite web | url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=21776 | title= Did You Find the Easter Eggs in Ratatouille? | date=2007-07-06 | accessdate=2010-02-27 | publisher=ComingSoon.net}}</ref><ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2007-06-29 |title = Ratatouille |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-14 |time = 1:16:29 }}</ref> ** Linguini's [[underwear|boxers]] have ''The Incredibles'' logo on them.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} *'''''WALL-E''''' **A Frozone bobblehead is seen in WALL-E's truck.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 26:07 }}</ref> In some BnL advertisements, including those in the special edition [[DVD]], there is a family who resembles the Parr family. *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **A poster of the Omnidroid is seen on the wall in Andy's room.{{Citation needed|date=June 2010}} *'''''Cars 2''''' **The marquee at the Radiator Springs Drive-In Theater reads "The Incredimobiles".<ref name="eeggs" />
===''Cars'' franchise=== These films and shorts contain references to ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'', ''[[Cars 2]]'' or ''[[Cars 3]]'': *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Al's car looks a lot like Flo. *'''''Finding Nemo''''' **Luigi can be seen driving across the street.<ref>{{cite video|date= 2003-05-30 |title= Finding Nemo |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-06-22 |time = 01:32:36}}</ref> *'''''The Incredibles''''' **When the Incredibles and Frozone fight against the Omnidroid, a non-[[anthropomorphic]] Doc [[Hudson Hornet|Hudson]] can be seen parked in the background. It actually survived being crushed or broken from the fight.<ref>{{cite video |date= 2004-11-05 |title= The Incredibles|medium= Motion Picture|publisher= Pixar|location= Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-03-07|time= 01:40:31}}</ref> *'''''WALL-E''''' ** A Lightning McQueen toy is seen.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} ** A Leak Less bottle is seen.<ref>{{cite video|date= 2008-06-27|title= WALL-E|medium= Motion Picture|publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2009-01-05|time= 10:51}}</ref> *'''''Boundin'''''' **Stanley makes a cameo appearance.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video|date= 2004-11-05|title= Boundin|medium = Motion Picture Short|publisher = Pixar|location = Emeryville, CA|accessdate = 2010-03-07|time = 0:01:08}}</ref> *'''''Up''''' **The airplane that was used to skywrite "Piston Cup" in the final race is the same one Beta, Gamma and an unknown dog used to attack Russell. **When Carl gets the worker's megaphone, he talks to the construction boss, and says to him, "Take a bath, hippie!". This line is a switchblade of Sarge's line to Fillmore in ''[[Cars (film)|Cars]]'', "Take a car wash, hippie!"'. *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **In the [[Western (genre)|Western]] action sequence at the beginning of Toy Story 3, the runaway train has the engine number 95, a reference to Lightning McQueen and the year the original ''Toy Story'' came out.<ref name="themovieblogts3" /> **A Lightning McQueen-styled wooden car appears in the Daycare.<ref name="themovieblogts3" /> **"ReVolting" batteries are seen on a table where some of the toys are playing cards. (ReVolting was the sponsor for Car #84.)<ref name="slashts3tt" /> **When Buzz shakes hands with Sparks, a tractor toy similar to the "cows" rolls past them.<ref name="slashts3tt" /> **The calendar in Andy's room which used to show an image from ''A Bug's Life'' now has a picture of a non-anthropomorphic Snot Rod from ''Cars''. Both calendars, years apart, are turned to the month of August.<ref name="slashts3film" /> **Finn McMissile is seen on a poster in Andy's room.<ref name="csts3">{{cite web | url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=67118 | publisher=ComingSoon.net | title=Your Toy Story 3 Easter Egg Guide | author=Silas Lesnick | date=2010-06-18 | accessdate=2010-06-21}}</ref> **A firetruck that resembles Red is seen at Sunnyside Daycare.<ref name="slashts3film">{{cite web | url=http://www.slashfilm.com/2010/06/18/toy-story-3-easter-eggs/ | title=Toy Story 3 Easter Eggs | author=Peter Sciretta | accessdate=2010-06-21 | date=2010-06-18 | publisher=Slashfilm}}</ref> **A child at Sunnyside Daycare wears a shirt with a 95 emblazoned with a lightning bolt, a reference to Lightning McQueen.<ref name="csts3" /> *'''''The Muppets''''' **Even though this isn't a Pixar film, a poster for ''Cars 2'' is seen several times.
===''Ratatouille''=== These films contain references to the film ''[[Ratatouille (film)|Ratatouille]]'': *'''''WALL-E''''' ** Skinner's scooter can be seen in the junkyard.<ref name="walleslashilm"/><ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 10:56 }}</ref> ** The mechanical mice on the ''Axiom'' are classified REM-E.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} *'''''Lifted''''' ** The farmer in the film, Ernie, is the same character model as Linguini. {{Citation needed|date=December 2010}} *'''''Cars 2''''' **In Paris, a car version of Gusteau's Restaurant is seen as "Gastow's" in the background.<ref name="eeggs" />
===''WALL-E''=== These films contain references to the film ''[[WALL-E]]'':
* '''''Cars''''' ** In a modified Piston Cup scene, WALL-E is seen as part of a team. * '''''The Incredibles''''' ** In a modified version of the sequence with Bob's new vintage sports car, WALL-E is seen in the garage. * '''''Your Friend, The Rat''''' ** WALL-E can be seen driving a bus-like ship on a future human-colonized Mars.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2007-11-06 |title = Your Friend The Rat |medium = Video |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-14 |time = 9:41 }}</ref>
===''Up''=== These films contain references to the film ''[[Up (2009 film)|Up]]: *'''''Ratatouille''''' **As Remy runs through Paris, a shadow of Dug is cast against a wall.<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2008-09-28|url=http://pixarblog.blogspot.com/2008/07/up-character-seen-in-ratatouille.html|title='Up' character seen in 'Ratatouille'|publisher=The Pixar Blog}}</ref><ref name="firstshowingup">{{cite web | url=http://www.firstshowing.net/2009/06/01/check-this-out-all-the-hidden-easter-eggs-in-pixars-up/ | title=Check This Out: All the Hidden Easter Eggs in Pixar's Up | accessdate=2010-02-27 | date=2009-06-01 | author=Alex Billington | publisher=FirstShowing.net}}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **One of the boxes Al of Al's Toy Barn is holding whilst arranging shipping of Woody and the other toys to Japan over the phone, has a house shaped arrow and the phrase 'This End UP' on the side. The word Up is displayed in capital letters and is quite prominent.<ref name="pixartalkee" /><ref>{{cite video |date = |title = Toy Story 2 |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-01-02 |time = 00:56:36}}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **One of the papers (which is a postcard) on top of Andy's dresser says "Carl and Ellie Fredricksen" on it.<ref name="csts3" /><ref name="jppts3tt">{{cite web | url=http://www.justpressplay.net/movies/movie-news/6032-what-to-take-away-from-the-qtoy-story-3q-trailer.html | title=What to Take Away from the "Toy Story 3" Trailer | author=Arya Ponto | date=2009-10-13 | publisher=JustPressPlay.net | accessdate=2010-03-21}}</ref>
===''Brave''=== These films or shorts contain references to the film ''[[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]]''. *'''''Cars 2''''' **During the London chase scene, the Lemons crash into a pub. On the wall is a tapestry depicting Princess {{Not a typo|Merida}} and her family as cars.<ref name="eeggs">{{cite web | url=http://www.eeggs.com/tree/13177.html | title=Cars 2 Easter Eggs | accessdate=2011-12-05}}</ref>
==Shorts==
===''The Adventures of André and Wally B.''=== These films contain references to ''[[The Adventures of André and Wally B.]]'': *'''''Red's Dream''''' **André is on a clock.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} *'''''Toy Story''''' **A book with the same title as the short is visible on Andy's bookshelf.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> *'''''WALL-E''''' **Wally B. is seen.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 1:32:13 }}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **Wally B. is seen on Bonnie's backpack.<ref name="csts3" />
===''Red's Dream''=== These films contain references to ''[[Red's Dream]]''. *'''''Toy Story''''' **The title of this short film is seen on a book in ''[[Toy Story]]''.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Scenes from the short film can be seen on Andy's TV when Hamm is quickly flipping through the channels. *'''''WALL-E''''' **The unicycle is visible at the left of the screen as WALL-E falls from the ceiling.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 26:32 }}</ref>
===''Luxo, Jr.''=== These films contain references to ''[[Luxo, Jr.]]'': *'''''Red's Dream''''' **The older lamp from ''Luxo, Jr.'' can be seen.{{Citation needed|date=August 2008}} *'''''Tin Toy''''' **A picture from Luxo, Jr. can be seen on the wall. *'''''Toy Story''''' **On Andy's desk is the older lamp, although painted red instead of gray. It's also seen in ''[[Toy Story 2]]''<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> and a trailer for ''[[Toy Story 3]]'' *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **As Buzz is flying back to Earth, Luxo. Jr appears as a constellation. **Scenes from the short film can be seen on Andy's TV when Hamm is quickly flipping through the channels.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **When Sully shows Mike the block of garbage that includes the remnants of Boo's costume, the antenna flops over with the same squeak that Luxo makes. *'''''WALL-E''''' **When WALL-E builds a statue of EVE from garbage, one of her arms is the older lamp.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2008-06-27 |title = WALL-E |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-11-26 |time = 20:58 }}</ref> *'''''Toy Story 3''''' ** When Woody is escaping from Sunnyside, he uses a motion sensor floodlight to get onto the roof. As he climbs on top of the light, it makes Luxo's distinctive squeak.
===''Tin Toy''=== These films contain references to ''[[Tin Toy]]'': *'''''Toy Story''''' **A book named after the short is on Andy's bookshelf: the author is [[John Lasseter|Lasseter]].<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Billy can be seen several times briefly on one of the channels on Andy's TV when Hamm is quickly flipping through the channels.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> *'''''Lifted''''' **Tinny can be seen underneath Ernie's bed. *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **The same toys are cowering beneath a counter as Rex approaches the door.<ref name="themovieblogts3" /><ref name="csts3" /><ref name="slashts3tt" /> *'''''El Materdor''''' **The baby's crying is used when Mater is "dead".
===''Knick Knack''=== These films contain references to ''[[Knick Knack]]'': *'''''Toy Story''''' **''Knick Knack'' is the title of a book on Andy's bookshelf.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /> *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Scenes from the short film can be seen on Andy's TV when Hamm is quickly flipping through the channels.<ref name="pixartalkee" /> *'''''WALL-E''''' **The snowglobe is seen.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} *'''''Up''''' **When Carl is at the Travel Agency, the brochure on the desk features a picture of "Sunny Miami," which includes the girl in the bikini from this short.<ref name="slashup" />
===''For the Birds''=== The following Pixar films reference ''[[For the Birds (film)|For the Birds]]'': *'''''Cars''''' **The birds are seen sitting on a powerline during the musical segment as Mack and Lightning drive across the country. They chirp as the camera pans by them.<ref name="jimhillmedia" /><ref>{{cite video |date = 2006-06-09 |title = Cars |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2008-10-15 |time = 17:44 }}</ref> *'''''Inside Out''''' **The birds can be seen sitting on a powerline at the beginning of the film when Riley and her parents are driving to San Francisco.
===''Geri's Game''=== These Pixar films contain the following references to ''[[Geri's Game]]'': *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Al hires Geri to restore Woody (credited as 'Geri the Cleaner'). His chess pieces are seen in the middle drawer of his toolbox.<ref name="pixartalkee" /><ref name="jimhillmedia" />
===''Boundin'''=== These Pixar films contain the following references to ''[[Boundin']]'': *'''''Cars''''' **During the opening race, just before a fan trailer whistles, a picture of the Jackalope is seen at the back of a van.<ref>{{cite video |date = 2006-06-09 |title = Cars |medium = Motion Picture |publisher = Pixar |location = Emeryville, CA |accessdate = 2010-03-21 |time = 00:02:54}}</ref> **At the menu screen of the DVD, a Dinoco 500 symbol pops up for a short period of time. Highlighting and selecting the symbol will reveal Lightning and Mater watching a part of Boundin' at the drive-in theater and later "boundin'" around to the film themselves.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}}
==The Pixar logo== *''[[Tin Toy]]'' **The original Pixar logo (an indented circle on a beveled box) can be seen on a bag lying on the ground. *''[[Toy Story 2]]'' **The original Pixar logo is briefly seen on Andy's TV when Hamm is flipping through the channels.
==Apple== These Pixar films contain the following references to [[Apple Inc.]]. *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **On the back cover of the magazine Mike receives near the end of the film reads “Scare Different”, a reference to Apple's slogan "Think Different".{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars''''' **A car in the opening race is number 84 and features the Apple logo on its hood. The 84 is in reference to the release date of the [[Macintosh 128K|first Apple Macintosh computer]] in 1984.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''WALL-E''''' **WALL-E watches ''[[Hello, Dolly! (film)|Hello, Dolly!]]'' on a video [[iPod]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **WALL-E makes the Mac startup chime when done charging.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Auto’s voice is created using [[PlainTalk]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **An old Mac keyboard is in WALL-E’s truck.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Up''''' **In one credit sequence photo, Carl is seen investigating a Mac mouse.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **A merit badge next to the Pixar Senior Staff credit references the spinning ball icon on Mac operating systems.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **The computer the toys use is an [[iMac]] with an Apple operating system, [[macOS|OS X]], and web browser, [[Safari (web browser)|Safari]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **While on his laptop, Andy has an [[iTunes]] window open.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Molly can be seen with Apple headphones as she discards her old toys.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars 2''''' **Finn McMissile says Holley's cover identity is “designing [[App Store (iOS)|iPhone apps]]”.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Brave''''' **The end credits feature a dedication to [[Steve Jobs]], the founder of Apple and chief executive of Pixar, who died in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2012/05/25/pixars-brave-pays-ghostly-tribute-to-steve-jobs|title=Pixar's ''Brave'' Pays Ghostly Tribute to Steve Jobs|website=The Wall Street Journal|last=Farley|first=Christopher|date=May 25, 2012|accessdate=January 12, 2015}}</ref> *'''''Cars 3''''' **One of the racing teams seen throughout the movie sponsored by Apple. {{Citation needed|date=July 2017}} **The treadmill which Cruz Ramirez takes with her to the beach activates with the [[Classic Mac OS|old Mac OS]] startup chime.

===References=== These Pixar films contain references to Pixar employees.
*'''''A Bug's Life''''' **One of the boxes in Bug City is marked "Darla" for producer [[Darla K. Anderson]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **On the "Top Scarers" board, under Sulley and Randall, is a monster named Ranft, a reference to [[Joe Ranft]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Finding Nemo''''' **[[Brad Bird|Brad Bird's]] son Nicholas provided the voice of [[Finding Nemo (franchise)#Cast_and_characters|Squirt]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Nicholas-Bird/|title=Nicholas Bird|author=|date=|work=behindthevoiceactors.com|accessdate=April 2, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ew.com/gallery/finding-nemo-voices/squirt-nicholas-bird|title=See The Voices Behind Your Favorite 'Finding Nemo' Characters|author=|date=May 31, 2016|work=ew.com|accessdate=April 2, 2017}}</ref> **The character of Darla was named after producer [[Darla K. Anderson]] by director [[Andrew Stanton]], to get back at her for playing practical jokes on him.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The name of a boat in Sydney Harbor is "Jerome's Raft", which is presumably a reference to Pixar sculptor Jerome Ranft.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''The Incredibles''''' **Legendary Animators [[Frank Thomas (animator)|Frank Thomas]] and [[Ollie Johnston]] voice themselves following the big fight with the Omnidroid.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **One storefront is labeled as Lozano Records, a tribute to Albert Lozano, a Pixar production artist.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Another storefront is labeled Arriaga & Co, after Pixar production assistant Daniel Arriaga.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars''''' **[[Lightning McQueen]] is named after animator [[Glenn McQueen]], who died in 2002.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Ratatouille''''' **A wine bottle in the beginning is labeled Lasseter Cabernet Sauvignon, a reference to executive producer [[John Lasseter]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **A wine bottle labeled Chateau-Bird Champagne is named for director [[Brad Bird]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **A wine bottle labeled Chateau-Jessup Pauillac Medoc is named for production designer [[Harley Jessup]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Colette rides a Calahan motorcycle, a reference to director of photography [[Sharon Calahan]].<ref>{{Citation |url= http://www.slashfilm.com/ratatouille-fun-facts/ |website=Slashfilm |title= Ratatouille Fun Facts |date=June 16, 2007 |first= Peter |last=Sciretta }}</ref> **The Bouchiba spaghetti Linguini cooks in his apartment is named after animator Bolhem Bouchiba.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The Bradford mixer in Gusteau's is named for producer [[Brad Lewis]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Susman olive oil in Gusteau's is named after associate producer Galyn Susman.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Up''''' **[[Up (2009 film)#Cast|Young Ellie]] is voiced by director [[Pete Docter]]'s daughter Elizabeth. She also provided some of the drawings shown by Ellie in the film.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **[[Up (2009 film)#Cast|Gamma]] is voiced by [[Joe Ranft|Joe Ranft's]] brother Jerome.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Russell's appearance was based on [[Peter Sohn]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The number 94070 on Carl’s court summons is the zip code for [[San Carlos, California|San Carlos]], where producer [[Brad Lewis]] was formerly the mayor.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **One piece of construction equipment behind Carl's house reads L-R 1572, a reference to art director [[Lou Romano]]. His birthday is April 15, 1972.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **Pins on the map in Andy’s room correspond to the hometowns of the production staff.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars 2''''' **In the London portion of the World Grand Prix, a banner advertises “Lassetyre” tires and a road is named "Lasseter Way", both references to director [[John Lasseter]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **In the end credits, Mater's birthday is revealed to be January 12, 1957, the same as [[John Lasseter|John Lasseter's]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}}
==Other== These Pixar films contain the following references to an assortment of other things.
===Films=== * '''''Toy Story''''' ** Sid's "laser" method to interrogate Woody about the Rebel base is a clear reference to ''[[Star Wars (film)|Star Wars]]'' and ''[[Goldfinger (film)|Goldfinger]]''. * '''''A Bug's Life''''' ** The wagons that transport P. T. Flea's Circus are empty cookie boxes with actual turning wheels. The brand of cookies was called "Casey Jr. Cookies", named after Casey Jr., the train that transported the circus in ''[[Dumbo]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''Toy Story 2''''' ** When Zurg reveals himself to be Buzz's father, this is a direct reference to ''[[The Empire Strikes Back]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''Finding Nemo''''' ** During the chase scene in the submarine, Bruce the shark breaks down a door saying "Here's Brucy!", a reference to ''[[The Shining (film)|The Shining]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''The Incredibles''''' ** The scene of [[Frozone#Frozone|Frozone]] being held at gunpoint by a nervous cop is a reference to a similar scene in ''[[Die Hard with a Vengeance]]'' which also features by [[Samuel L. Jackson]]. Even the officer's facial design is similar.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} ** Helen Parr uses the code name "India Gulf Niner Niner" (IG99) for the jet she flies to Syndrome's base, a reference to director [[Brad Bird]]'s 1999 film, ''[[The Iron Giant]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} ** At Syndrome's base, Elastigirl looks at herself in a mirror and sighs when she sees her butt. This is a direct reference to ''[[Peter Pan (1953 film)|Peter Pan]]'', in which [[Tinker Bell]] looks at herself in a mirror at the Darlings' home and sighs when seeing her butt.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''WALL-E''''' ** Auto's design is a reference to [[HAL 9000]] of ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'', which also featured a red "eye" in the center of his body.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} ** The music playing when the Captain gets up on his own two feet to defeat Auto is [[Richard Strauss|Strauss']] "[[Also sprach Zarathustra (Strauss)|Also Sprach Zarathustra]]" which is well known as the theme to ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''BURN-E''''' ** During the [[Hyperspace (fiction)|hyperjump]] of the ''[[Axiom]]'', the reflection of a light tunnel can be seen in BURN-E's glass visor that resembles the transportation scene in the last part of ''2001: A Space Odyssey''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}}<!---It is not a "warp", probably referring to the "Star Trek" warp drive!---> * '''''Up''''' ** The license plate of the ambulance is "1934", the year Disney began work on ''[[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937 film)|Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The dogs check communication similar to the Rebels before the attack on the [[Death Star]], in ''[[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope]]'', referring to one as "Gray Leader" instead of "Red Leader".{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **''[[Star Wars]]'' is listed on a movie theater marquee during the end credits.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Day and Night''''' **In the short film, "Day" watches the same western film as the dalmatian puppies in ''[[One Hundred and One Dalmatians|101 Dalmatians]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **Totoro, from Hayao Miyazaki‘s 1988 film ''[[My Neighbor Totoro]]'' makes an appearance in Bonnie's room.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The number in Trixie's screen name (Velocistar237) is a reference to ''[[The Shining (film)|The Shining]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} * '''''Cars 2''''' ** The bathroom fight in Tokyo is a reference to the pre-credits sequence in the 2006 ''[[James Bond in film|James Bond]]'' film, ''[[Casino Royale (2006 film)|Casino Royale]]''.<!---Someone credited it as the omonimous 1967 satire Bond film, which does not feature a bathroom fight scene!--->
===TV shows=== *'''''Toy Story''''' **Sid uses a Binford Tools toolbox to trap Woody in a crate, a reference to the company from [[Tim Allen|Tim Allen's]] show ''[[Home Improvement (TV series)|Home Improvement]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 2''''' **Zurg's robots in the Buzz game have scanners like those from [[Cylon (Battlestar Galactica)|Cyclons]] in ''[[Battlestar Galactica]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **The lunchbox Buzz grabs in the landfill is of ''[[The Six Million Dollar Man]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}}
===Miscellaneous=== *'''''Toy Story''''' **When Buzz is pushed out the window by the lamp the [[Wilhelm scream]] is played.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''A Bug's Life''''' **A poster for Disney's ''[[The Lion King (musical)|The Lion King]]'' musical can be seen amongst posters in Bug City.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 2''''' ** The video game Rex is playing (Buzz Lightyear: Attack on Zurg!) is played on an [[Super NES|SNES]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Monsters, Inc.''''' **The letters "FIZT" on the door machine are a reference to the application used to control the movement of Sulley's fur.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **In one of the children's bedrooms, posters for [[Disneyland|Disneyland's]] [[Sailing Ship Columbia]] and [[Tomorrowland]] are seen.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The Hidden City Cafe can be seen in the opening scene, which is where the idea for Monsters, Inc. was thought up.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''The Incredibles''''' **At the beginning of the film, the streets on Mr. Incredible's GPS are streets near the Pixar Animation Studios Building.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars''''' **When a car is hit by a laser in Lightning McQueen's dream, there is a [[Wilhelm scream]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The mountain range surrounding Radiator Springs, called Cadillac Range, is a reference to [[Cadillac Ranch]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **The neon lights on top of Flo's V8 Cafe are the same pattern as a 1932 [[Ford flathead V8 engine|Ford V8 Flathead]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **As the jets fly over for the final race an aerial view of the Pixar studios is seen to the left.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Announcers mention that the whole town of [[Emeryville, California|Emeryville]], the location of the Pixar Studios, is closed for the big race.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **In [[Lightning McQueen]]'s Rusteze advertisement, one car's license plate reads "EVILLE", which could be a nickname for [[Emeryville, California|Emeryville]], the location of [[Pixar Animation Studios]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Lifted''''' **During the end credits of this [[Lifted (2006 film)|short film]] the [[Wilhelm scream]] is played.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Ratatouille''''' **A storefront called Bar Des 7 Chanceux is named for the "Lucky 7 Lounge", a secret lounge inside Pixar Animation Studios.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **In his last review from Gusteau's restaurant, Anton Ego makes reference to [[Chef Boyardee]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''WALL-E''''' **When leaving Earth's atmosphere, one of the satellites Wall-E runs into is ''[[Sputnik 1]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Up''''' **Carl and Russell eat ice cream at [[Fentons Creamery]], a famous ice cream parlor in [[Oakland]].{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **When the dogs fall off a cliff while chasing Carl and Russell, a [[Wilhelm scream]] can be heard.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Russell passes a room where a bunch of dogs are playing poker in a reference to the [[Cassius Marcellus Coolidge|C.M. Coolidge]] painting ''[[Dogs Playing Poker]]''.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Toy Story 3''''' **During the opening scene, when Andy and his toys watch a scary movie, the [[Wilhelm scream]] can be heard.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **Above Andy’s closet is a street sign for W. Cutting Blvd., the street where Pixar’s original headquarters were located.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **A pennant on one of Andy's walls reads “P.U.”, for Pixar University, a development program for Pixar employees.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} **An application on Andy's bulletin board is for a college in [[Emeryville, California|Emeryville]], the location of the Pixar Studios.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars 2''''' **Mater references the [[State Farm Insurance]] jingle, when he mistakes "secret agent" for "insurance agent".{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}} *'''''Cars 3''''' **The name of Cruz's personal assistant, Hamilton, is a reference to the musical [[Hamilton (musical)|Hamilton.]]
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
